a: I’m Queenie Shu-Ying Hsiao — a product designer who makes simplicity feel exciting again. I started in Fashion Design at Parsons, then shifted into Human–Computer Interaction at NYU’s Interactive Telecommunications Program. I’ve designed at Uber, and co-found the UX Club @ NYU where I currently am president, blending storytelling, interaction, and visual systems into playful but clear experiences.

q: What roles are you looking for?
a: Product Design roles in NYC, open to hybrid, in-person, or remote opportunities.
Email or LinkedIn in my site footer — happy to chat!
I previously interned at Uber and am currently President of NYU's UX Club.
I focus on visual UI and UX design, crafting interactions that make simplicity feel exciting again. I love blending clarity with delight in every project.
UI/UX design, interaction design, visual design, design systems, AI products, storytelling, and design strategy.
My main toolkit includes Figma, dscout, Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, After Effects, Premiere Pro), Protopie, Origami, and Cursor.

UX Club is a student-run organization focused on building a community for product designers at NYU, I co-founded the club in 2024 and currently serve as president. I wanted to create a community of design focused individual who wanted to connect with industry professionals and learn from other students. I oversee all aspects of the club, but mainly focus on events and design. We host speaker events, run mentorship socials, and organize a design-a-thon — creating both the experiences and the visuals that bring the community together.
I’m inspired by minimalism, delight, and anything that feels exciting — experiences that are simple, clear, and spark joy.

I start by framing the problem, researching users, and sketching flows. Then I refine into high-fidelity UI systems and test iteratively. I collaborate closely with PMs, engineers, and researchers to balance clarity with delight.
